google_play_reviews.content: I love it. I also love how unlike other mobile apps there are no ads at all. I've found it perfect for my needs and the only thing I think that could be useful would be an in app checklist so you can keep track of what you still need to type up. That is me being very nit picky though. I've highly recommended this app to my friends as well.
Please add more categories or options to create more categories, like deities, creatures, and events.
Fairly good! Works awesome, but could y'all please add a history/lore feature? It would really help.
No hate just haven't checked it out yet I'll review again when I have used the app
Great for quickly recording ideas & really good for organizing & documenting world building.

Amazing app, works smoothly and great, easy to use, GUI. I do have a few suggestions, like making an account system so that you can share data between devices, and making more categories, such as species, political parties and religions. However altogether it is a very good app and I would definitely recommend it!

I had a family member who used this app, and then heavily request it to me for my story writing, and it is amazing. There are no ads (that i've seen upon the making of this post), it's all free, there are customizable settings, you can have multiple worlds in the making, and just all around great.
Excuse me, I am trying to use this app on my phone and it is not letting me type at all. The only typing it is letting me do is making the name of my world, can you tell me how to type please.
Epic worldbuilding tool, must have!
Wrote one article. Would not let me write another one ever again. Would just crash or bring me back to main menu. Literally unusable
Loved it. Wish it had a collaborative option so I can use it instead of world anvil, which doesn't have an app. I wouldn't mind paying for that feature.

A very good app for world building, but theres one thing missing for me and that is to add a timeline feature. its quite a pain to explain to others about the timeline of the world, so I hope you can add this feature in the future.

Brilliant app, have used it frequently for D&D worldbuilding and it's been super helpful, but recently it has become unable to open. It tells me to change the data location, but doesn't give me the option to do so and crashes. It looks like all my data is lost? Not sure what to do.
Great way to organize your thoughts. You can tag, cross reference, and associate characters with the Snippets feature and the character tab.
Simple and Works, just a bit plain sometimes.

Nice and simple, but a little too simple The app is great, but a docked a point for its lack a feature. I could create my own groups and folders as well as more control of what categories of information to include. At the very least format options would help. When you making a long campaign you will be grouping dozens of npcs, towns, land marks, cities and builds all in the same spot. It gets cluttered.
This is a very helpful app for those who are into worldbuilding or authors.
No problems, very malleable, I love it
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ni, we're sorry to hear that you encountered slowdown within the app. We've recently released a new update that significantly speeds up performance on Android 10 and 11 devices. The update is being rolled out in phases, so you should be receiving it in the next few days. We hope that this will fix the issue for you!

google_play_reviews.content: This app is great! I've been using it for a few months, and I love it. It is very clean and easy to use,and the linking feature is great too. And to top it off, no adds! It would be nice it it did have bold and italics, and custom categories would be awesome too. Could you also add an option to back up to Google Docs? Thanks!
My entire world just vanished. I updated the app and everything I spent hours working on completely vanished. Cannot even begin to express how furious I am.

I love it. It's great for world building. This comment is more for a question than anything. When is world scribe 2 coming to mobile. Everything on that application is what would make this app perfect.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Smitty, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: Upon renaming a character, the app instead crested a duplicate, and deleted ALL other characters.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Funkythulhu, we're sorry to hear that your data was lost due to a renaming bug. If you could tell us the character's old name and new name at this email address, we would be more than happy to investigate this issue further: support@averistudios.com

google_play_reviews.content: The app is good, I wrote a lot of stuff about my worldbuilding project. But i would suggest a few features. Firstly, i think it would be nice to have more than one picture in an article. It would really help understand what i'm writing and i sometimes can't have one picture to represent it all. Second, i would like a way to make your own categories. Third, i think it would also be nice to make some folders to organize your articles. Overall, i think the app is very good!
All of my data got deleted! My worlds disappeared and i dont know how to get them back! Help!!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andi, we're really sorry that this has happened to you. Can you please check that there is a "WorldScribe" folder somewhere in your phone's file storage? If there is, please try reinstalling the app and following the set up to make your data appear again. If your data is still missing afterwards, please contact us at: support@averistudios.com

google_play_reviews.content: Wrote a review for this a while ago, and had it mysteriously vanish.. this app has had an issue where it duplicates articles several times, and then makes them impossible to delete. Two of my worlds are now clogged with empty articles, and it is making the app unusable. Please fix this.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Isaac, we're sorry that you've encountered this issue. (We're also sorry to hear about your vanishing review; we've noticed a few other reviews have vanished as well, so it might be a Play Store glitch.) If you could email us more details at this address, we'd be more than happy to help: support@averistudios.com

google_play_reviews.content: Sometimes when i create a new character or a group it copies it, and when i delete it copies again

Great app, one reccomendation, make sub catagories ex: locations might go continent-state-cities, etc so that people can more easily find stuff in a large world. if you could do that id never even think about an alternative to this app, I have not found one bug so far so props for that! Keep up the good work!
Seems to work fine now!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Patricia, can you try making a new World with new Articles, and see if the duplication still occurs? If you still encounter issues, please let us know at support@averistudios.com . Sorry for the inconvenience!

google_play_reviews.content: Cant import worlds I've created on other devices. Dropbox linkup only backs it up. Meaning I just lost all the info since it was on my old dead tablet... Upsetting, but I figured i would give it another go. However I immediately ran into more problems. Renamed an article and it just made a new one. So i tried to delete it instead and it made a copy of it. I could delete the copy, but not the original. It just makes another copy when I try. Not worth using sadly, maybe someday it will be better.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tsula, we're sorry to hear that you've been experiencing these issues. If you have the World backed up to Dropbox, you can import it by copying its folder into the "WorldScribe" folder on your device. For the duplication issues, we'd be happy to discuss them further with you at support@averistudios.com

google_play_reviews.content: Very good for worldbuilding. Dropbox backup is very nice.

Works very well! One issue, though, is that inputting a "/" causes an error, and doesn't create the file. So use "\", "-", "|", or similar special characters instead. This is a common and understandable issue, so I hold nothing against the app developers because of this minor inconvenience. Edit: Also occurs with "." (period.)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Zaxstar, thanks for the feedback! Yes, "/" and "." will cause errors because they are special characters in the local file system, which is what the app uses to store World data. Thank you for pointing this out! We will look into adding a warning and/or prohibiting these characters to prevent issues in the future.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is very great i just wanted to suggest sub catagories for the articles
I really enjoyed this app. I put many hours into this app, and created a very in depth world...then they did an update. And I lost everything!!! Been hesitant to reinstall and start all over again
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Stephen, we're really sorry to hear that! All of your data should be stored in the "WorldScribe" folder in your phone's file storage, so can you please check that it still exists on your phone? If it does, you should be able to fix this issue by reinstalling the app. If that still doesn't work out, please contact us at: support@averistudios.com

google_play_reviews.content: Great app for world building. But that's it. Don't expect to write your whole novel in this. This is solely for organizing all the elements that may conform your story. And it fills its role perfectly. It does take a little tinkering with the app to start understanding it. And, in my personal case, I didn't enjoyed the interface too much, because of it's aesthetic. But good app anyway.

Fantastic app. Great for building character, location, race profiles and loads more. I use it for getting my book writing ideas all together but I think it would be perfect for D&D profiles and plans too if that's what you'd want to use it for.
Such a useful app, the best of its kind on the play store! Having those custom categories would complete it well. Hint hint. Crashes fixed, thank goodness.
Good for organizing informations.
Perfect! I would be very happy to get a new column, something like creatures/animals or plants.
This app is of great use to me, but I switched phones today and it gives me an error every time I try to load a new world. The phone model is a Galaxy S20
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for reporting this error! Can you please tell us about this in more detail, including screenshots of the error if possible? You can reach us at averistudios@gmail.com

google_play_reviews.content: I counted 40 seconds I had to wait for an article to open and another 10 to close. Every movement causes lag. I'm even angrier because I cleansed my entire device to ensure that I wasn't the problem and it still seems the world I've been working on since February is nigh unbearable to go through now after I updated yesterday. I would also normally just delete the app and use another but as I've said, I invested 5 months of time into what is now wasted effort. Pls fix
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ali, thank you for the feedback! The app encounters slowdown on Android 10 devices because of a significant change Google made to file access. Once we fix the critical issue a few users are facing, we will prioritize optimizing the app for Android 10. We'd also appreciate it if you could tell us more about these issues at averistudios@gmail.com.

google_play_reviews.content: I loved it, but with the current update it's broken, keeps asking for permission to use the storage and when I point it to its folder or any folder it fails to accept it. Says something about the root directory in ../emulated/0
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Forrest, we've just released a new update that fixes this issue. If you haven't received it yet, it should be downloaded onto your device within the next few days. Please feel free to let us know if you're still encountering issues afterwards! You can reach us at averistudios@gmail.com

google_play_reviews.content: Quite good, although I do think it could be a little bit better in some regards.

I used it for a day and when I came back everything was gone. I should not have to back up my work constantly because the app won't work properly. Until this problem is fixed I would not recommend this app.

The app is great for world building, but the only thing keeping me from rating it five stars is that, when creating a snippet, if you click the arrrow to go back it won't always save what you wrote, so you have to push the triangle button (on your phone at the bottom of the screen next to the cutcle home button and recent screens button) to go back and save your work, but I donno always remember to do that. I've lost many things due to this, so I hope it can be fixed ASAP.

Very useful program for making worlds and characters. Free with no ads currently. Missing sync from cloud storage but you can back up to dropbox. Unfortunately it may never get a full sync feature because they are basically abandoning this to make a web app that they are having a hard time figure out. Do what you need to and fix this app. Seriously. I've been through dozens and I like this one the best.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Derek, thank you for the kind words. We'd just like to clarify that we aren't "abandoning" the Android app. Right now, we have our hands full investigating a critical issue affecting a small subset of users. As such, we apologize for the lack of updates as of late, but we just want to ensure the next release is usable for everyone.

google_play_reviews.content: Well made, intergrated and simple template structures for easy world building. ðŸ™Œ
Wonderful app for world building, It helps me be creative
Very good. I can build a world deep and immersive with this to keep my sanity with the politics and places.
Excellent. The ability to connect entries is absolutely what I needed. Simple, elegant, organized format.
Love it, it's easy to navigate and simple to use just wish there was a category for races and creatures

This is exactly what I was looking for, this is a great place to organize my thought and ideas for stories and it does not limit me whatsoever. I really like how I can have multiple worlds and the connection tab is tremendous. This app makes it much easier to build a fluid world that is well connected.

Excellent app. Clean and simple to use/ get the hang of, and the developers respond to feedback really quickly. Now the crashing problem is fixed, the aforementioned five stars are very deserved. Couldn't recommend more highly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi James, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: World scribe is a wonderful app for first time Dm/Gms and even players. I've use it for several campaigns now and I've never been more satisfied. The design is easy to maneuver and I like what's being done with it as well as it's updates. I've grown to depend on it for organization purposes. The developers are active and quick to fix issues as well which makes using the app very homely; at least for me. I could see areas where things can be added but the possibilities of the app are limitless.

I've had this app on my phone for months and I haven't used it in a while. I logged on tonight to use it to plan a new project and after being bombarded to agree to the terms (again) and back up the app, I'm presented with a button to create a new world. I tap it repeatedly and nothing happens :( I love this app's style and simplicity, and don't want to settle with another app to do my planning. Any way you guys can fix it and hopefully soon??
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Abby, we're sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue. Please contact us at averistudios@gmail.com so that we can help you troubleshoot this issue in more detail.

google_play_reviews.content: Just the fact that someone took the time to make such a cool app is worth 5 stars alone. But this app really is awesome. I've been an amateur "world builder" and fen ConLanger for decades and this is the first real app for those like us. Thank you to the developer!
Working fine now thank you!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: This is the first world building app that allows me to simply and self-explanatory order my thoughts for P&P campaigns. If the developers add the option to link between worlds (to allow more complex connections between e.g. countries/continents without becoming to cluttered) and allow for events to be created it's going to be a fifth star and a donation from me.

I have one request. Is it possible that you could make the option to add folders in your different sections such as people or locations within a country for organisational purposes. Besides that a great app that helps me run tabletop RPGs as well as my own writing perfectly. Thank You.
Don't understand why I couldn't see the articles while I was in the same session i created them, but after restarting it now, they showed up.
Has stopped working. Won't let me access my data. Asks me to select the "WordScribe" folder and allow access to it-- I do and it still doesn't work.
Pretty good

Eversince the new updates I have lost the majority of my work. I have the back up saves of some of them thankfully, but the app no longer works or lets me open up the world I made. Don't know what happened but I'm not pleased with my current situation. Perhaps I'm doing something wrong but I just want my work back.
Thanks, I downloaded the app again and it works perfectly. It's an excellent app.

I really like this app, couldn't find a better world building app. But theres recently been an issue with data location. When i pick a place to store, the app well crash everytime preventing me from using the app

It wouldn't open! After I allowed it access, it immediately crashed and every time i tried to open it, it kept crashing. Sucks cause i wanted to try it out. EDIT: After installing the update, it worked like a charm! So far I'm enjoying it!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Vanyla, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: I have been using this app for several weeks without issue, and have put a lot of information into it. There was a glitch which they quickly rectified, and with good communication on their part. I'm giving this 5 stars not just because it's an easy to use app which helps me co-ordinate many disparate concepts, but also because they fixed the issue when they said they would. Great job!!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andy, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Don't worry: your data is still safe in the "WorldScribe" folder on your phone.  Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. Please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com if you're still having issues.

google_play_reviews.content: There was an issue in the new update, but it was fixed within a few days.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Marisa, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: It works great, thank you for the update. This is a great app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andy, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and great.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi OtÃ¡vio, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: After downloading the latest update the app crashes whenever I try to open it. Edit: The developers quickly fixed the crashing issue. This app is deserving of 5 stars. It's the most useful of its kind that I have found. It's simple to use and not overwhelming like other Worldbuilding apps.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Richard, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: After latest update crashes upon starting. Edit: Works again after last update. Thank you
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: Worked fine until the recent update. Now it won't load at all.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. If you're still encountering issues after the update, please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com so we can discuss this in greater detail.

google_play_reviews.content: Been using this for a while, and I love it, but after the latest update I'm unable to open it at all. I really don't want to lose all my work, so I hope this is fixed soon.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Julien, we're sorry to hear that you've encountered this problem. Don't worry: your data is still safe in the "WorldScribe" folder on your phone.  Just now, we've released a new update that fixes this crash. It should be live within the next 24 hours. Please feel free to email us at averistudios@gmail.com if you're still having issues.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is awesome but needs an update badly. I'm using a Samsung 10 and everything is slow and sluggish to the point of unusable, if that was fixed then it would be great. Also, making everything (like members and residents) sorted into alphabetical order would be nice.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Daryl, thanks for catching the sorting inconsistencies; we'll definitely look into fixing that in an update soon!
As for the slowness, we'd be interested to hear more about which parts of the app are slow and how long you end up having to wait each time. Please send us an email at averistudios@gmail.com and we'll look into it pronto.

google_play_reviews.content: This app does exactly what it says on the tin and unlike most other free apps made to help writers it is truly free, you can access all features without having to pay anything and you don't have ads or pop-ups asking for money. One thing to bear in mind however is that this app is made to help people build a setting not necessarily write a novel. If your aim is to write a story from beginning to end there are better apps. If you want to world build, this is the best free app you can get.
Super good app, love it!
It's a great platform, but it needs a longer description of what different cattegories are for, also it lacks map creation.

Love this app! It has a great system for connections and relationships with endless possibilities. The only thing that would make it better would be the ability to add and/or change some of the various groupings to separate out certain info.

I am giving this app a 5 because, when it worked on my phone, it was the single most useful story writing app out there. The fact that it lacks questions and boxes to fill out is a plus for me, because it feels like I have more control over my story. I should point out that, since the update that was related to Android's ToS, the app has been broken and crashes when I try to designate a save folder. This obviously won't happen to everyone but I would like sone assistance, if possible.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Zion, thanks for the kind words! We're sorry to hear that you had issues with the latest update. Please send us an email at averistudios@gmail.com with more details (as well as screenshots if possible) and we'll look into it pronto.

google_play_reviews.content: Started using this recently. Was initially skeptical, but after using a bit I came to realize that what it does it does very well. Of course it doesn't have all the bells and whistles of something like Worldanvil, but it also doesn't use a subscription model or make the most useful features only available in the higher tiers. If you can afford all that that's great, but worldscribe does all the basics just fine and you can't beat the price.
Great app but could you please add the feature that allows us to create our own custom tabs because sometimes it doesnt make sense to put a deity in the people tab and history in the places tab
Incredibly useful. Does exactly what it says on the tin. Some small improvements needed but otherwise it's perfect.
So nicely organized and easy to use.
Can you make it so you can put places in places like a house in a village or a castle in a kingdom
Cannot change the font, does not have a proper storry creation mode. UI is not optimised.

World Scribe is helping me so much for organizing information (I'm such a wreck) and it's really simple and straightforward. My only request would be to see a "gallery" option to add images for characters, places, concepts, etc. Thank you and continue updating this amazing app!
World scribe is fun because you can make your own little worlds and characters easily
I love the app. Just wish they had a pc version that would work. Then it'd get a 5 star for sure!
This a great app for what it was designed to do! Simple and easy enough to navigate, only thing I'd like to see is a possibility to adding your own category but otherwise very happy
This app does it's job perfectly. Easy and not a hastle to use.
THIS IS PERFECT
I love the app but I have no way to share anything I make with others.
The possiblilities are endless.
My world disappeared after half a day of populating it.

This is a great app. Its not as overwhelming as i have found others that help character creation, while still allowing a place to easily store them. I would like it if you could make connections between organisations and characters in the snippets, just so that i could keep track of what is about who, and if the names could have little icons of their profilea pictures. Its not as anxiety inducing as other apps of a similar nature, which i am very thankful for. Overall, a great app.
Its just neat, nothin more to say, recommending for people who are reading this.

This app is amazing. I use it for running pen and paper rpg's and it has no equal. The only things I can think of that would make it better, would be an easy way to print to a cloud-ready printer and a few more tabs to sort like 'historical events'.
What a fantastic app! Easy to use and very helpful as a world building tool. Kudos to the developer!

I've just started using it but it's extremely useful. I absolutely adore that you can make connections between different things. I would, however, love to see categories for things like animals, and basic metadata like geography, weather, seasons, political structure(s), lamguage, clothing... etc. hope these will be implemented in the future in some way!

I really like this app, I find it amazing, simple to use and easy to sink hours and hours into. But I do feel like you could also include a new sub-category for events of the world. I believe it could help add depth to characters places items and concepts.
very good for getting ideas down and helping to create your world
Very easy to use and a great world builder. Is there a way to edit the same world on different devices?

Amazing tool for creating any array of fictional universes. But it's so much better than a great tool. It's so intuitive and simple, that it's fun to use. It makes me want to create another story. It makes me want to open the app again and again. Not through push notifications or meaningless "achievements" many mobile apps now have, but through just being amazing. This app could get away with just being categorized notes marketed as a world builder and still be good, but it goes above and beyond with connections, affiliations, and simple snippet categories. World Scribe is beyond amazing. 5 stars.
It's okay.

This is exactly what I needed! It's crazy how there is no alternative on Android at all. How about adding an extra page where you can just write an introduction to the world, or a summary of the story that this world is for?
Pls add 'event' article category

I've been using it for almost two years, and I can't recommend it enough. The interface is really simple, but it allows a surprising amount of depth for world building. I had an issue with backing up to Dropbox and one hour later support had the answer. Great team, great app.
Please make me able to create new category
Needs custom categories, it's hard to plan out monsters without a solid place to put them (for example)

I started using this app to make a D&D world just a few days ago, and let me tell you, it is phenomenal. I have a very atypical way of thinking and this makes it so much easier to compile my ideas. If I could give this more stars, I would.
I didn't even understand how to use it
One thing I'd recommend is an option to hyperlink articles in text. Otherwise, it's great!

Awesome app. It'd be great if there were a way to sort the articles, maybe an option to sort everything alphabetically as well as another option to manually sort articles (maybe there's a button in the menu that switches you to "sort" mode where you can only sort articles, not edit) in case someone wants to keep the most important articles at the top.
If there was some sort of Events tab or timeline this app would be perfect. However, it's already almost there. Please add some feature like that soon.

The app is pretty adequate and nice, although I would really want to get a History or Timeline section so that we can have a linear way to track how events are going. Perhaps sections about plant and animal life would work, as well, or something about religions, belief systems, and technology levels.

I love that this app exists... I know in the change log there was dropbox fixes but mine keeps crashing... I made a second world and it saves nu the main one I am working on isn't backing up... scary to think I'd loose it. However can I suggest there be a way you can manually save a backup?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Jakob, you can manually backup your World by going into your device''s storage, opening the 'WorldScribe' folder, and copying the folder with your World's name onto your PC. To load that backup into the app, just copy that folder back into the 'WorldScribe' folder on your device.
That said, we're planning to fix Dropbox issues ASAP!

google_play_reviews.content:
If you put an emoji for label/sorting purposes, it makes the article 
disappear, but it will tell you it exists if you try to recreate it. 
Example: I tried to mark restaurant locations with a cheeseburger icon, but 
it bugged the article.

I like this app, it allows me to compile my characters and map out their 
connections and overall concepts of the story. The only thing I am truly 
missing is a timeline feature! I am a visual person so being able to attach 
multiple photos and/or music would also help me build a more vivid world. 
Thanks so much for this app! Looking forward to updates to come.

It's a really good app I recommend this app to everyone, but one thing I 
think should be add is a family greens you can see all the connections.

It's honestly amazing, it could use some new features, but it isn't bad 
without them either, so.
Used it countless times for my DMing, simply the best worldbuilding app on the PlayStore.
Awesome

I've been using World Scribe to keep track of some notes for world building 
for about 2 years now, I was loving the simplicity of it and being able to 
connect events to other things is also a handy thing to have. 
Unfortunately, that world of 2 years was just deleted because of some user 
error on my end. Only reason being the "Delete Article" and "Delete World" 
buttons are in the same tab. I was trying to delete a single article as I 
have a million times, but instead was not paying attention and hit Delete 
World. Luckily I have most of my information stored else where so it is not 
all lost. One change I would make is to move the "Delete World" button to 
the settings page, as to avoid confusion. Deleting a world is a big 
decision to make, and hopefully moving it will deter anyone else from 
making the same mistake as I.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Simon, thank you for the feedback! I'm sorry to hear about your accident; we definitely take part of the blame for letting that design blunder make its way to release. We've been thinking about cleaning and reorganizing the overflow menus for quite a while now, so your suggestion will definitely be at the top of the list for the next update.

google_play_reviews.content:
amazing app! I'm naturally disorganized, and this app solved all my issues 
keeping my ideas together!

I really like this app! It helps keep my world-building organized and 
easily connected. The only thing I wish it had was a "Races/Peoples" tab. 
Granted, I can just throw elves and dwarves into the "Groups" tab, but I 
feel that tab is more suited for things like guilds and organizations.

I'm really enjoying this app for getting down world ideas and connections! It can be a little confusing at first, but that doesn't take much away from my experience. An improvement would be to add a better way to share worlds with others for collaborative building or just ease of sharing info to friends. Shared editing might be cool, but I would settle for just shared viewing within the app.

Love this app! So easy to organise entire stories and have their elements 
connected together! My advice is add more attributes we can add to elements 
and perhaps a more controllable personal interface.

You need a tutorial video guys its hard to navigate so information 
explained in app info is great but vage and little confusing for first time 
users

As of this rating, the only problems are 1) No tutorial, so you have to 
make assumptions due to the simple language not giving a proper general 
idea for its described object(s), like with the "Connections"-part that the 
screenshots only clarify what each segment means, & 2) No export function 
other than "Backup to Dropbox", in case you want to either store it 
somewhere other than your phone, or if you wanted to edit it elsewhere; 
barring these limitations, however, it is an impressive free app for its 
purpose.
GREATEST APP EVER
I am Loving it so far as it is helping me with my newest campaign for DnD
Great world building app

Great app. My only request would be more ways to sort the information. In 
connections, for instance, it would be nice to have a clear separation 
between different types of connections (people, places, items, concepts). I 
know the app puts people all first, then places, items, and concepts 
respectively in the connections list, but if a certain article has a lot of 
connections it can be complicated going back to view the data later. A 
small quibble really. Overall I'm really impressed with it. Edit: one other 
major request as far as features go. Some way to sync between multiple 
devices would be great. Even if it's just a way to import the Dropbox back 
ups back in to world scribe, that way I can back up from one device and 
download it to another, would be great.
Great app for DM'ing and writing alike! Wish it had desktop compatibility,though.
This app is a tad bit addictive for a creative mind. Within seconds, I had a world created and story forming around my world. Great for aspiring authors.
This is beautiful
Major update needed! Hope it is being worked on.
There's no section for races/species, which is kind of essential to a lot of fantasy/scifi fiction.
I've had this app for a year and put my entire worldbuilding universe in it. Just checked it today and every description that I worked years on is just gone! Beyond furious.

I really enjoy using this to keep track of my world and NPCs as well as just random ideas I have that I want to throw in to the campaign but haven't found the place yet. The only thing I wish it had is a way to nest locations within each other, like put a number of towns under a drop-down menu with the country they are all in. It would just be easier to manage a lot of locations if I could sort them geographically.

this app is by far the best free tool for this purpose. after searching around online, every website offering similar features either was in closed beta, had a clunky design or had premium subscriptions. this app is what i use to record the details of my personal project, and it's very good at that. i personally like the concepts category. one thing i would add is the ability to creat subcategories of the concepts category, as many different things can fall under that umbrella. overall, this is a great app, and has not failed me once. Thank you for this app!

Like this app. A search function would be nice though as I my memory isn't so great. With the main characters, side characters and some random characters I might want to reuse in the future, keeping track of them is getting hard. I would love to be able to immediately look up characters of certain genders, race and occupation that lives in a certain place. Also not having an autocorrect system that change whatever fantasy name I come up with is a plus. It does still have suggestions that I appreciate (though it might be the Google keyboard I'm using).
Will be great if we can compile some worlds in a one collection (?). It also will be good if we can edit the text to make it italic or bold or etc. But at the other things this app is really useful.
Really good for Dnd to make a world. One feature id like is to be able to have towns and cities as an option then places to link the places within town or city.  New York -> The Horse and Hare pub.

Amazing! It's simple enough that you don't get lost trying to figure out how everything is organized, but still very powerful -- I really like how you can connect concepts and groups and people together very quickly, and then review those connections at a glance. Just downloaded it, so I don't have much to say yet, but that jumped out at me right quick!
Great app having some issues backing up to Dropbox though some of the main world folder and the folder names are their but none of the actual information when I press backup it just says error

I'm really enjoying this app it's allowing me to easily create a world I've been scrapping together for a year. It'd be awesome though if you could add a world history section to outline events that's happened to the world. You've done a great job!
Good app. It will be useful if you add two more groups. One timeline- so you can organise the events or history Two chapters- so you might as well right the story or a novel
Needs an Event category. Other than that and some things other reviews have already covered, it's great.
Great app! Just about all you can ask for, especially for mobile organization. However, it could use color themes that are less bright/harsher to the eye.

Great app. The only thing I would say should be changed is the way you view the people in a group when you go into that group. At the moment it's too clunky and would be better if it was in more of a list form. Also a timeline of events feature, wed digram and lineage tabs would be very cool.Thanks
I love this app so much! it's so useful to keep track of all the characters from my original stories!!
Incredibly useful for making encyclopaedias for your own worlds. The only problem I have is that every image makes its own folder on my device, but thats inconsequential compared to the benefits.

I have been looking for something like this for some time - there's no other app like this one, so pretty happy about that. However, it needs a timeline category that allows for events within the world to be described. I'm building a world that spans a 1000 years & I definitely need that function. & truthfully, I believe anyone building a *world* does. Hope to see this added & then I can give it 5 stars. Otherwise, great idea & glad to see it.
Easy to use and understand, and really useful to keep track of things.
A brilliant app for organising ideas. It's available completely free without annoying pay-to-unlock features which makes it a must download for all novel writers, RPG developers and the like!

A VERY good App for World Building. It can be as detailed as you allow it to be. I do worry though as I fill up the main five groups, that it will be difficult to navigate through them to find specific people or stories relating to them. I'll probably have to navigate through the largest thing (town name) and work down from there through "relations". It also would be nice to have some way to seperate Countries from towns and such, but it's not too much of a hassle doing it as I'm doing it already. :D
Very useful app for game masters. Easy to use and flexible enough to be used with any RPG campaign.

Absolutely fantastic. I would, however, recommend adding another tab for "events". At the moment, I'm keeping track of my world's wars with the "concepts" tab, and it's slightly frustrating. Customizing the text size would be greatly appreciated as well.
Amazing application it also helps that it is free with no ads if I find a way to support the dev i would truely send them something. simple to use and i have had no issues so far.

Good for keeping track of all the things in your world, only gripe is there isn't an events section or any sort of customization for the section (no custom sections). Other than that its worth the space.

This app is great for keeping tabs on everything going on in your story when you're world building, but if you have a phone with the capability, DO NOT use this app in splitscreen mode. I tried it once and I lost everything!
Great app to keep everything tidy and best of all: no adds and completely free

This app is perfect. It is clean, simple, and to the point. It's ideal for novels, screenplays, and roleplays. However, a spiderweb view mode would be nice, as well as a terminology tab, an event tab, and a character trait subsection.
OH SOOO GOOD WE LOVE  IT. (dude I'm not joking like I really don't thinkâ€‹ it's bad) it's good.

I love this app! I have been using it for a while for tabletop rpg's to keep track of NPCs, locations, and items. Now that I'm getting back to my novel, I've been using it for that as well, and then tonight I was trying to think of a way to organize one of my conlangs and could find no better app than this one. Highly recommend for writers, worldbuilders, and GM's!
So far I'm enjoying it, but a section for terminology and a section for events would be nice.

The app is great, and it has made it much easier to keep notes on NPCs. One minor nitpick: I really dislike that adding an image to an entry in the app creates a new album in my phone's gallery that contains only that one image. Now my gallery is cluttered with dozens of extra albums. Everything else is great, that one thing is just annoying to me.
Exactly what I was looking for to design my fantasy campaign setting.
A great app to write out campaign settings. It's easy to use and very organized. The only minus is that it isn't available on PC, so you have to do everything on mobile.
Great, simple, works. I really wish there were some basic interface customization. I would pay.

Almost 5 stars, could use a mode for tablets, but my main concern is an error when trying to backup to drop box. I prefer google drive but i know thats a pain to integrate. However im a bit worried about loosing my work shoild something go wrong since i cant even back up to drop box. Im on a samsung galaxy tab 2 running android 7.0
Very helpful for organization.  Would be nice if it had a timeline though.  Would also be helpful to make it available for PC.
It's a great tool, especially with all the connections and such. It really needs a timeline though

I have looked for a long time for an application that would be able to detail a world of such size as my own, but all the little Mindmap applications either had ads clogging up precious screenspace, or had all the features I needed locked behind a paywall. This application, although not in the format I find easiest to navigate, has done more than all the other apps I've tried combined. It feels like an encyclopedia rather than a bubble of text. Easy to navigate, easy to edit, this app is easily the best app for detailing entire worlds. The only suggestions I could recommend would be a spider chart view, where every article could be a section in a Web, as well as making the snippets side by side instead of a list, so I don't need to scroll past entire pages just to find one. 5/5 stars.
The app is great but it fail to backup to Dropbox. Would be nice to check the meaning of each term in the app instead of checking the app store page for the information.

An excellent tool for organizing ideas. I hope the developers continue to improve it -- more customization options, like being able to adjust the font size and edit field descriptions, would be greatly appreciated -- but as it stands it's still an enormously useful app.

[Update: very grateful that author continues to update this robust freeware writing tool!]  Timeline function & ability to modify connections between elements are still missing but everything else is there for keeping track of world building. Simple, readable outside app and so effective!
Great job making this!
Great app, still needs improvement

Nice app, would be nice if it had custom tabs. Connection webs would be good too, rather than just adding a little box for each time I connect a smaller concept or location to a larger one. It kind of hurts seeing the same thing over and over again because one city contains multiple districts, and instead of having them all listed in one box it just makes hundreds of new boxes with one entry. Aside from being kinda picky about that, the app is pretty helpful, 4/5 would recommend.

This app is amazing so far. The only thing I am missing is the category events. As I have created my world over a long timespan with multiple events over different ages. The possibility to have subfolders within categories to sort my "Lands" and not have them mixed up with my "Small towns" would also really help.

Sure its good. But when you add something as it's picture, let's say, you give a character a picture -- then it resaves the picture you cropped and this picture has it's own folder in my gallery. If resaving is something inevitable, then it'd be nice if they were all grouped together because it takes up unnecessary space. Also it'd be great to have a customizable sections.

It looks really good so far. Plenty of scope and flexibility, now it needs a little refinement to allow the user to tailor it a little more to their need.  Adding/Amending categories would be great. A sync to other devices (phone, tablet, laptop) perhaps a web app?  One category I think is missing is an 'Event' category for world events, like a Battle, or founding date for a group or place, these could then be used to create a timeline. A timeline could then help to build a skeleton for a story arc.

Already nice but would love, if we could add our own categories and rename the existing ones. Additionally i'd be nice to be able to add subcategories to entries and be able to sort by them because categories with a lot of entries can get cluttered. Lastly more options would be awesome like a more compact layout. Great work so far and hope you keep it up
It's a good start, but not sure why you can upload to dropbox but not download.  I can't find anyway to sync between devices.  A web app would be good also.
Great tool!
It needs: - Dropbox sync, not just backup but also import.  - Life tab, as People and Groups are inadequate to describe the physiology and inherent behaviors of fauna, flora and sentient races.

It'd be nice if it offered custom fields and catagories. I have characters across a few stories and I'd like the option of "Appeared in this world."  Great app, though. I like that I can go into files and manually edit if I so chose.
Needs more features
Pretty cool. Lets me make worlds and all. Just what I need since what I'm writing has a lot of worlds...
"External storage" requirement is ridiculous. The Samsung Galaxy S7 doesn't HAVE external storage. Uninstalled because it won't run due to developer stupidity.
it's great for organising story characters

I downloaded this on a whim to try it out and it has greatly helped me organize my creation of a deep and complicated world. I would give it five stars but it lacks factions as a tab. Plus groups can't have subgroups as far as I can tell.
Good
Really needs a creatures/species category, or an option to make custom categories with some preset icon options.
Valued tool for organization.

World Scribe is a fantastic tool. It offers exactly what I have been looking for for a while now and it's set up is like an open invitation to delve deeper into one's own creativity. Thank you for sharing this tool with writers and daydreamers worldwide!
Pure brilliance my DM game just got danker
A nice that let's you categorize your ideas. I especially like the fact that    everything can be linked to one thing or another. A nice tool for those who need something to get their ideas in order.
I tried this putting without really knowing what I wanted but after trying this I was amazed how useful it was for world building! Awesome, thanks!
I just opened the app and as soon as the app said to name the world. I instantly give this app 5 stars.

I love it, but I think there's so much potential yet to be recognized. For example, I have several different races and animal species(and some flora) in my world, but there's no category that really fits this really well, so for now they're all stuck as a group. Keep up the good work, though! Hopefully you're still working on this.
I absolutely love this app. My only request is The ability to move one something to a different category without re-writing it. Cheers!

An incredibly helpful, flexible tool for worldbuilding. It has the capacity to export to Dropbox, or you can draw the well-organized text files directly from the World Scribe folder in your device's external storage. I can't wait to see how this app develops and can't recommend it enough. Thank you to the developer!

I like the functionality of being able to enter in characters, Concepts items and all of the different categories and subcategories that is a great idea the one thing that I think this app is missing is a flow chart of you so I can see how all the characters in the world interconnect in different ways how the different groups meet through different people and how all the different items are connected to different people and where it touches them and the Snippets that goes along with that.

Alright, so this review is based on what the app has, such as the ability to create people, groups, items, and places. Absolutely amazing set up and smooth layout. I give 5 stars for what is has, but I would love if you could add a time-line function, and an event section.
Ive been waiting for an APP like this for ages.
I like the whole app, though I think more categories would be useful, like other than people it could have creatures, tribes, rituals etc and more details for all the categories
I absolutely love this app. It helped me conceptualize a world many years in the making. But where are the EVENTS? ?????????????

This is a great app, and the idea is definitely a 5-star idea, but it lacks in a few departments; hence the 4-star rating.  Pros: excellent for developing entire worlds from a continent, down to the ring a person wears; fun to navigate through your world by creating connections to people, places, and objects; pleasant UI.  Cons: saves images to their own unique individual folders (each character gets their own folder with a resaved cropped image); no desktop app (not really a con, but would LOVE it)  Highly recommend this app for writers and game designers.
I would like it if there was an event tab

After only a few minutes of fumbling around in the app I have figured out the name of several characters and places. I also now have a s**t ton of ideas. This is a great app! *will edit my response if I find things I don't like.
This the only one that is really helpful

Doesn't need "Fixes" necessarily. More like upgrades. Like a cloud or some sort of back up. I'm afraid if I have to get a new phone and reinstall the app, I'll have to start over. Also, maybe a tool for a light tutorial. Most everything is self explanatory. I'm talking more about a "recommended" way to use certain tabs. Like Snippets. Ideas and ways to use them effectively. But that's not a game breaker at all. It'll just make things smoother and enable someone to get to work, in my opinion.  Awesome app.

Its design and organization soothe and satisfy my OCD excellently; it is a truly useful app for those who wish to create/design their own worlds, characters, settings, etc. Wish that Person articles had an inventory section, much like the memberships section though.
Could use sub categories and adding multiple categories under another one.
This app is great, but I have a suggestion. You should add a section for religions. It could include gods, followers, values, rules, rituals, etc.

This app is PERFECT. It is absolutely everything a writer needs to create a detailed, interconnected world. When I first had it, I was giddy with excitement for it. Then... After I had, not one, but TWO entire worlds mapped out, EVERY SINGLE LINK began shutting the app down. In other words, I can't actually access 95% of the information on my worlds. I've done everything I can think of on my end to eliminate anything that could be causing the bug. Anxiously awaiting an update and hoping for a bug fix.
I'm a little concerned because there doesn't appear to be a way to save the data you enter. If my phone dies, it seems that I will lose everything I've entered in :\
Great app, I do think that there is room for improvement though.

Love the app. Helps a lot when building different things. But it could be better if the options for races, animals and plant life could be added. It would be even more amazing if a function of tree diagram was available.

Finally, I found an app that can help me in creating a world for my story. However, please make some adjustments in the font size of the app. It is too big for me. And also make some adjustments of the backgrounds color. It is quite disturbing for me. Thank you.
Keeps crashing on "locations" tab

Like many others, i too would scribble or memorize details of my world only to lose the thought or paper. Now it's all organized. Some suggestions: More grouping sets [Languages, etc], Folder options within sections for grouping people, search ability, a bit tighter UI (it's great but a bit bigger than needed at times).

While overall one if the best apps for this purpose I've seen, there are definitely places I'd like to see improvement. The connections system is great, but for concepts a little broken. I use concept for species, so want to make an "is a" relationship but can't with the current setup.
If a timeline is implemented it'll go from being head and shoulders to a whole torso above the rest
The UI is super neat and grouping up info is extremely easy. What would be an amazing addition would be the ability to attach images (maps) and then being able to link people to places visually
nvm i'm dumb. it's perfect.

Does what it says on the tin  and with a clean, intuitive layout. Something that would be super-handy would be a timeline maker of some sort, but still rad without one.  Look forward to seeing more of this dev's work!

The only feedback I can give is for additional features such as being able to search for when you have lots of thing and need to get something quickly, The ability to create custom groups aside from the main five or alternatively create folders within them, and expanded sorting options (date created, last modified,  alphabetical). These would make an already fantastic app even better,  but without these additional features it's still a work of goddamn genius.
Works perfectly. Very simple to navigate and use. Would love an export option! I could also go for a dark theme.
This is super useful for organization that I can access quickly
A wonderful tool for keeping track of world building ideas. Very clean and easy to use.

So far I like it. It's nice and simple. Pretty user friendly. Just been messing with it for a few minutes, but I can really see how this would make it easy to keep track of people, how they fit in with different places, how the places are connected, etc. Kind of interested to see what else you add.
Only feature missing is some kind of 'events' category, then this would be perfect.

I used to struggle to find something to write on, or haphazardly write myself a disorganized memo when inspiration struck.  Now, with this app I can write as soon as the idea hits in a clear concise manner while linking certain bits together.  Definitely a life saver, an export function would be nice but I love the project as it is right now.
Great and simple to use for jotting down and categorising ideas for world building.
Visually clean, not cluttered like some apps I've tried before. One thing I'd like to see is a dark theme, something for nighttime viewing. A good example would be Discord's dark theme.
only thing missing is an export option
This app is so nice and simple, no complicated features.  Perfect.  Although some kind of export function would be nice.
Great little worldbuilding tool, I've tried a number of apps, and this one shines. Great job!
Clean, simple to use interface hiding surprising depth. Very nice.
Crashed on startup the first time but it seems to be working great now! Thanks!
An amazing app. It will save me a fortune in journals.
World building app at its finest
Very Simple, Great Organizational Tool
Brilliant simple tool that's coming in mighty handy with my GM prep for some tabletop sessions. Can't wait to see what future features you might add :D
Hi Reddit.
